comments.raw_text:
I was developing a WordPress theme, testing it on the various browsers and OSes, and I found out a weird behaviour of Firefox (7.0.1): element borders are rendered differently depending on the OS kind and the OS version.

I'm attaching 4 screenshots of what I get with Debian testing, Windows XP, Windows 7 and osX 10.6.
If you look at the screenshots, more precisely at the main menu on the top, you'll see that on linux and XP everything is rendered correctly: the borders of the menu tabs and of the title below merge together and the border of the tabs goes on  top of the one of the title div. On Seven and osX on the other side, the two borders doesn't collapse and I should add a "margin-top: -1px" to the title div to have a correct displaying.

Other browser I've tested: IE8 and 9 render the menu correctly on XP and 7, Opera render the menu correctly on linux and XP (I haven't tested on 7 and osX) and webkit browsers (Chrome, Safari, Rekonq, Chromium) all render it the wrong way on linux, osX, XP (but I've added a special css rule so it displays correctly).

If you want to make a live test you can use this url: http://www.iacchi.org/wp_new/ (I'll keep it there until the bug is closed).
There might be a mistake in the css code, but then: shouldn't the error be rendered in the same way anyway?
